TopicTitle: [1.0.4][Kopernicus]KerbolPlus v.2.3.9 - a planet pack that ads the legendary Gas Planet 2 and more.

Articles.Content: *sigh* As in how? Planets not loading? KSC glitching, black screen of death (aka Hell Kraken)?
planets not loading.

Works good, right? Last time I tested it was all lookin' good!
What are you doing now.

What are you doing now.

Enjoying the rest of my vacantion in England, in a few hours! No work to K+ will be done for at least one month, when i'll have a lot more time to properly test things.

SPOILER: Today I learned how to make a procedural planet with PQS mods, so I remade Fonso proceduraly! Now it has large ridges that kind of look like Slate's mountains!

SPOILER: Finished the Crystal model for Faz's new ground scatter!

Cheers and I hope to see ya'll soon, (Ashley is in his special trust chair since he made most of the textures and configs) after I return from England!

:cool:

loads well for me. i'll test to see if the planets/moons are landable a bit later.

enjoy your vacation!
Procedural...planet??? I love you.

Hey I just tried landing on Vix in the new version. Still broken. Please make the existing content at least playable before continuing to add new features...otherwise what's the point of new bodies if you can't land on them?

I am anyway thinking about entirely remaking the planets withPQS mods, if possible. Procedural Fonso looks alright, even trough my ....ty laptop crashed when PQS was loading during testing. Cheers, stop pesting, have pacience and wait till I find the problem!

No words.

But yeah, even testing this in vanilla (32-bit, I normally use 64-bit, but I don't report 64-bit issues without testing in 32-bit), except for Kerbal Construction Time, the vessel situation remains "flying low" at least in testing on Pergas once you've reached 0m on the radar altimeter, in KER or IVA readouts.

Edit: Also a similar issue related to landing, parachutes seem to be going off of sea level instead of terrain, so landing at 5000m+ on Pergas means your parachutes do not open til you hit the ground. As far as I was aware, parachutes open at terrain level, not sea level.

so 2.3.9

Amarius, ignore this individual.

As a note, I did try landing and still had the same issue of not being able to leave because "vessel was under acceleration". That said, I only tested Vix and Harvest, so I don't know how wide spread it is.

Yeah, maybe... But our planets are a whole lot different.

Amarius, do what multiple people have repeatedly advised you to do: Start with one planet, only one, and make sure that it works. If it does not, take a working template that is as uncomplicated as possible and modify it piece by piece to find out where exactly your additions cause problems. Then, after you have made absolutely sure that absolutely everything works as desired, you move on to the next planet and repeat this process until everything works.

I can see why one might be reluctant to do this - it costs a lot of time and is not fun at all, but it will fix your problems and, perhaps more importantly, teach you something about their causes. It is no one else's responsibility to help you fix problems that you caused and that are very much in your own power to fix.

Yeah, maybe... But our planets are a whole lot different.

My assumption (perhaps wrong) is that not being able to land on your planets and leave the ship for the space centre because "under acceleration" is a simple, but perhaps not obvious, fix. I'm assuming that all "landable" bodies (not gas planets) have some common features?

If you don't mind, I'll do some research and poking around!
